answers.answer: If you feel like there is something wrong I would go to l&d . What is the worst that could happen they check you out and the baby out and they tell you are fine and send you home. At least you will have peace of mind
I got preeclampisa around that time during my last pregnancy I felt dizzy and lathargic all the time it was my BP getting high....but it was usually after being up doing something not laying in bed
Turns out,  I am having contractions.  Had to go to L&D. And get a shot to stop labor.  Omgees that sucked!! Made my heart race!! I'm back home now resting.  Thanxx lady's for your answer's

You have gestational diabetes too, so be careful it isn't your blood sugar going to low or high. If too low it can cause preterm labor. I am glad you are doing better and hope baby can stay in there a little long. I am glad you followed your instinct and wentertainment to L&D.
Listen to your gut. If you feel something is wrong it probably is you know your body better then anyone else. Had i not listened to mine my son wouldn't be here today.
You know your body... I would definitely just go to the hospital.
Glad your feeling better now. What is L&D?
Is that in the states? I recently moved to the states and am not sure what's available here!
Thanks! So helpful to know!!! X
On my third and been dizzy the whole time. Just found out i have low blood pressure which is not a bad thing but can cause you dizziness. I was told to eat more salt.

How are you feeling!? What's the update if you don't mind me asking. I'm sorry I can't see your other comments and most likely you said it there. Are you high risk due to the gd or something else? Is that why you're getting the nst's regularly. I have diabetes thats why I ask sorry!!   I'm scared I'm gonna go through the same.

Glad to hear you're doing better!! Omg I'm gonna be more alert now then. I get monitoring for my sugars every two to three weeks but no nst or anything like that, I'm gonna ask lots of questions next visit.

question: This morning,  while laying in bed the room was spinning!  Tried closing my eyes a few times it didn't help. That was at 8 am. Its now 11:30 am and I'm still dizzy.  Feeling sick (as always) very drained and tired but I got plenty of sleep! Called my Dr,  the phone nurse said everything is fine, though I'm high risk and have to go for a nst today at two as I do twice a week. Not sure if I should just take my self my L&D?  Just blow it off? Go for my nst & see what happens?  I just feel something is wrong,  and it's my third pregnancy so I'm not new to this. Any advice?
title: dizziness @ 30 weeks
